summary: This document is an email chain from April 16, 2020, involving FBI and UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) officials. The FCA is investigating Barclays CEO James Staley's fitness for duty based on his past relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The FCA seeks information from the FBI regarding the nature and extent of Staley's connections to Epstein and any awareness of Epstein's misconduct.

events.title: FCA Opens Investigation into James Staley
events.description: The UK Financial Conduct Authority opens a regulatory investigation into James Staley concerning his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and his fitness to serve as Barclays CEO.

keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is conducting a regulatory investigation into Barclays CEO James Staley concerning his past relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and his fitness for duty.
James Staley claims his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein ended in 2015, before he became CEO of Barclays, and that he was unaware of Epstein's alleged misconduct.
The FCA was put in contact with a source by the SDNY DOJ (Edward) who provided additional links between Staley and Epstein, though this information had not been corroborated as of April 2020.
The FCA's investigation considers whether Staley failed to act with integrity, was not open with the FCA, and failed to disclose relevant information.
The FBI was contacted for potential assistance, but an FBI official had initially indicated they likely had nothing to provide regarding the FCA's fitness-for-duty inquiry.
